Course Description: The objective of this course is to provide introduction to chemoinformatics, an interdisciplinary area on the interface of chemistry, informatics and biology. The student will be provided with understanding of fundamentals of chemoinformatics and its applications. Through lectures, hands-on exercises and assignments, the student is expected to achieve a good grasp of the concepts and applications of chemoinformatics.

Prerequisites.Mandatory: Knowledge of chemistry, algorithms, programming and machine learning (Desirable)

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to explain basic concepts of chemoinformatics.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to explain and implement computation of molecular descriptors and chemical similarity.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to classify small molecules and interpret results from chemoinformatics analysis.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Motivation for data and informatics driven view of chemistry, Applications for drug discovery, Scope, opportunities and challenges
Introduction to Organic structures and their properties
Representation and manipulation of 2D & 3D molecular structures
Analysis of high-throughput screening data and Virtual screening

Textbook: An Introduction to Chemoinformatics, Leach and Gillet (Springer)
Reference Book: Organic Chemistry by Morrison and Boyd (Pearson India)
